snippet: Although regarded as heavy underdogs, the Devils can advance to the Eastern Conference finals with a victory on Tuesday in Philadelphia.
abstract: NHL Roundup; New Jersey Devils defeat Philadelphia Flyers, 4-2, to lead Eastern Conference semifinals, 3-1. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: NEWARK -- The Philadelphia Flyers' steely playoff resolve, held in check for the last three games by an unrelenting Devils' attack, finally melted with four seconds left in the second period Sunday, when Claude Giroux thrust his right shoulder into Dainius Zubrus's head. Two minutes earlier, Zubrus had scored the go-ahead goal in the Devils' 4-2 victory, and Giroux, the Flyers' skilled and intense forward, was incensed over a non-call at the other end of the ice. He decked Zubrus, who stayed down for a while.

headline.main: Devils in Control as Flyers Lose Lead and Composure
